page.title: 04FARMING AT STOKE-ON-TERN
page.content: STOKE MANOR Stoke Manor is a farm with about 350 acres.In one of the fields there used to be a castle,but people cannoned it from the trees by Petsey Manor.The only thing left of it now is the moat overgrown with nettles.In the house there is a table with a plaque on top of it,which has some writing on it. It says: "this table came out of the Eye Farm,an old black and white Elizabethan House mentioned in the Domesday Book as the Manor of Eye on the Leighton House Estate in the Parish of Leighton County Shropshire." The farmer has a collection of cast iron seats from old horse drawn vehicles. He collects old tractors too. On the farm he uses very modern
